# Physical Perception Augmentation

Physical perception augmentation explores how interactive technologies can extend or reshape human sensory experience. In HCI, this often involves wearables, tangible interfaces, and feedback systems that add new channels of information or modify how existing senses work.

# Reification in Human-Computer Interaction

Reification is the process of turning abstract concepts into concrete objects that people can see, manipulate, and reason about. In Human-Computer Interaction (HCI), reification is a powerful design strategy for making complex systems understandable and learnable.

# Visual Accessibility in Interfaces

Visual accessibility ensures that people with diverse visual abilities can perceive and use digital interfaces. It is a core aspect of inclusive HCI, grounded in both ethical responsibility and practical benefits: accessible products reach more users and often become clearer for everyone.
